text: Douglas Hunt Trumbull (; April 8, 1942 â€“ February 7, 2022) was an American movie director, special effects supervisor, and inventor. He was known for his special photographic effects of 2001: A Space Odyssey, Close Encounters of the Third Kind, Star Trek: The Motion Picture, Blade Runner and The Tree of Life. He directed the movies Silent Running and Brainstorm. Trumbull was born in Los Angeles, California. In 1979, he won a Saturn Award. Trumbull died at a hospital in Albany, New York on February 7, 2022 from a stroke caused by brain cancer at the age of 79. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Deaths from brain cancer Category:Cancer deaths in New York (state) Category:American inventors Category:Movie directors from Los Angeles
title: Douglas Trumbull
